Entries.default: "Can't say I recognize your fishy mug. Which means you ought not to be up here."
"I can't ever forget your face. Yet you seem to have forgotten my warning."
"That's it, lamprey-lips. Me and you - and a few dozen of my crew - are going to have a go."
"You're a dead one now!"
[Attack] "That's enough out of you."
[Back away with your hands up.] "No need to be rude."

"Curse me for a canting pullet! Was it something I said?"

Cackling, she draws her weapons.
"It's not that I don't trust you... but seeing as I don't trust you half so far as I can throw you, I'll be escorting you down."
"Why's that?"

"Benweth's watching the Deadlight for Captain Aeldys in her absence. He gets the privilege on account of them going way back." She sniffs and rubs a swollen knuckle over a spot of dried blood under one nostril.
"Enough prattling. For now, only Benweth's personal crewmates are permitted into Deadlight's heights. You ain't one."
"Snake Eyes says you're a real loser."
"I'll put a whinger through his nose holes. See what he says then."
"Snake Eyes Condwen! You cheating sack of entrails! You'd best be ready to pay up - my coin or your life."
"It doesn't sound like you've come to settle your debt... So I've got a game to run, if you don't mind."
"You lubberly squid-shit. I know about the rigged die."
"Wh-what?! What slammakey lies! I'm cleaner than a spit-shined culverin, don't make no doubt of that."
"I've lost enough to you. But it don't got to include my pride. I'm hauling you to the dungeons!"
"By gods..."
"Like you're so hot."
Her busted, bloodied lips split a cocksure grin. With a bruise-knuckled hand, she blows you a kiss.
"Your ma thought me plenty spicy last night."
"Just let me through. Please."
"Would you like to recognize mine?"
"Sorry, fish-breath, but you don't quite meet my standards." Her nose crinkles in distaste.
"I think I do."
"I really don't."
"If you know what I mean."
"You get in a fight recently?"
"If you're thinking it's because of him being one of her crew when she commanded a man-of-war in the Dyrwoodan navy..."
"Then you'd be right." She spits a tooth out.
"Way back when, Brutal Ben was one of Aeldys' own crew. They sailed a man-of-war she commanded in the Dyrwoodan navy."
"Oughtn't you to know that, though?"
"Had a spot of trouble at the forge. It's sorted now, though." Her eyes brighten as she rasps a rough laugh.
"Don't be worrying none about my kisser."
"None happening, shellback."
"So swim off."
"I'm going to split you double, skipjack."
"That fucking scupper's in want of a gutting. It's not enough that he swipes my coin, but he's got to grab for my pride, too?"
"What'd he say? Precisely."
[Lie] "He boasted of using a rigged die to cheat you."
"That you can't roll a seven to save your life."
"Rot and wounds! It's that bloody fucking die of his. I knew it."
"I heard you owe Snake Eyes quite a debt."
"Who told you that? Was it Condwen? That chunk of rotted hagfish! He ought to know when to keep his mouth shut."
"I heard that he cheats."
"He's a pus-poxed swindler?!"
"I've found that he's using weighted dice."
"What do you mean you don't know? You're one of us ain't you - Pr√≠ncipi, through and through?"
"I drink too much. Makes me forget things."
"I am, but... uh... I'm a new recruit...?"
"Aye. Who isn't a sodden prick around here? You're in good company."
"Fresh off the boat won't work with me, skipjack. Everyone knows about our Brutal Ben and Aeldys."
"I drink too much. Makes me forget things."
"I meant, I did know."
"Aye. Who isn't a sodden prick around here? You're in good company."
"Maybe. Or maybe you didn't. Everyone knows about our Brutal Ben and Aeldys. So if you don't... I'm thinking maybe you ain't one of us."
"Aye, aye. I was told to let you pass. And not to give you any trouble."
